| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1388](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1388 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

The **catoblepas** is a monster added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It possesses a fatal [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze") attack that will kill you immediately if you are not [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [magic resistant](/wiki/Magic_resistant "Magic resistant"), or [reflecting](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").

## Gaze attack

The gaze attack has a fairly low accuracy: there is a 75% chance that it will miss plus another 66% if you are either invisible or displaced. If you are reflecting and the gaze would have connected, then it will kill the gazer.

## Generation

Although the catoblepas is not randomly generated, it *is* a valid polymorphable form, so it is perfectly possible for a [chameleon](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon") or intelligent monster with a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") or [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") to suddenly turn into a catoblepas. It is also possible to self polymorph into a catoblepas, but beware of monsters with reflection, as a reflected gaze of death will kill you even if you have reflection yourself.

Strangely, the catoblepas is a unique monster, yet also genocidable. This is mostly irrelevant, but if you wish for the corpse of one in [wizard mode](/wiki/Wizard_mode "Wizard mode"), it will be described as "The catoblepas' corpse" rather than "A catoblepas corpse."

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[catoblepas](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/catoblepas "wikipedia:catoblepas")***

The catoblepas is a legendary creature first appearing in the writings of Roman historian and naturalist Pliny the Elder. It was described as a large quadruped from Ethiopia, with a very heavy head held in a downwards position; the name comes from the Greek for "to look downwards". It was said to possess a gaze or breath capable of [turning people to stone](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification") or simply killing them.

Like the [unicorn](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn"), the catoblepas is thought to be based on fanciful descriptions of real animals, in particular gnus or buffalo.

Catoblepas

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
q catoblepas
Difficulty 10
Attacks Gaze 2d6 Touch of death, Bite 1d3
q catoblepas
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Gaze 2d6 Touch of death, Bite 1d3

Base level 6
Base experience 118
Speed 6
Base AC 7
Base MR 10
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 500
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A catoblepas:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • hits creatures as a +2 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1388

The catoblepas is a monster added in SLASH'EM. It possesses a fatal gaze attack that will kill you immediately if you are not undead, blind, magic resistant, or reflecting.

Gaze attack

The gaze attack has a fairly low accuracy: there is a 75% chance that it will miss plus another 66% if you are either invisible or displaced. If you are reflecting and the gaze would have connected, then it will kill the gazer.

Generation

Although the catoblepas is not randomly generated, it is a valid polymorphable form, so it is perfectly possible for a chameleon or intelligent monster with a wand of polymorph or polymorph trap to suddenly turn into a catoblepas. It is also possible to self polymorph into a catoblepas, but beware of monsters with reflection, as a reflected gaze of death will kill you even if you have reflection yourself.

Strangely, the catoblepas is a unique monster, yet also genocidable. This is mostly irrelevant, but if you wish for the corpse of one in wizard mode, it will be described as "The catoblepas' corpse" rather than "A catoblepas corpse."

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
catoblepas

The catoblepas is a legendary creature first appearing in the writings of Roman historian and naturalist Pliny the Elder. It was described as a large quadruped from Ethiopia, with a very heavy head held in a downwards position; the name comes from the Greek for "to look downwards". It was said to possess a gaze or breath capable of turning people to stone or simply killing them.

Like the unicorn, the catoblepas is thought to be based on fanciful descriptions of real animals, in particular gnus or buffalo.

The '''catoblepas''' is a monster added in [[SLASH'EM]]. It possesses a fatal [[gaze]] attack that will kill you immediately if you are not [[undead]], [[blind]], [[magic resistant]], or [[reflection|reflecting]]. 

==Gaze attack==
The gaze attack has a fairly low accuracy: there is a 75% chance that it will miss plus another 66% if you are either invisible or displaced. If you are reflecting and the gaze would have connected, then it will kill the gazer. 

==Generation==
Although the catoblepas is not randomly generated, it ''is'' a valid polymorphable form, so it is perfectly possible for a [[chameleon]] or intelligent monster with a [[wand of polymorph]] or [[polymorph trap]] to suddenly turn into a catoblepas. It is also possible to self polymorph into a catoblepas, but beware of monsters with reflection, as a reflected gaze of death will kill you even if you have reflection yourself.

Strangely, the catoblepas is a unique monster, yet also genocidable.  This is mostly irrelevant, but if you wish for the corpse of one in [[wizard mode]], it will be described as "The catoblepas' corpse" rather than "A catoblepas corpse."
[[Category:SLASH'EM monsters]]

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|catoblepas}}
The catoblepas is a legendary creature first appearing in the writings of Roman historian and naturalist Pliny the Elder. It was described as a large quadruped from Ethiopia, with a very heavy head held in a downwards position; the name comes from the Greek for "to look downwards". It was said to possess a gaze or breath capable of [[petrification|turning people to stone]] or simply killing them.  

Like the [[unicorn]], the catoblepas is thought to be based on fanciful descriptions of real animals, in particular gnus or buffalo.
